verses.verse: Come <WG71> now, <WG3568> you rich, <WG4145> weep <WG2799> and howl <WG3649> for <WG1909> your <WG5216> miseries <WG5004> that are coming on you. <WG1904>
Your <WG5216> riches <WG4149> are corrupted <WG4595> and <WG2532> your <WG5216> garments <WG2440> are <WG1096> moth-eaten. <WG4598>

Your <WG5216> gold <WG5557> and <WG2532> your <WG5216> silver <WG696> are corroded, <WG2728> and <WG2532> their <WG846> corrosion <WG2447> will be <WG2071> for a testimony <WG3142> against <WG1519> you, <WG5213> and <WG2532> will eat <WG5315> your <WG5216> flesh <WG4561> like fire. <WG4442> You have laid up your treasure <WG2343> in <WG1722> the last <WG2078> days. <WG2250>

Behold, <WG2400> the wages <WG3408> of the laborers <WG2040> who <WG3588> mowed <WG270> your <WG5216> fields, <WG5561> which <WG575> you <WG5216> have kept back by fraud, <WG650> cry <WG2896> out, <WG2532> and the cries <WG2896> of those <WG3588> who reaped <WG2325> have entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the ears <WG3775> of the Lord <WG2962> of Armies. <WG4519>

You have lived delicately <WG5171> on <WG1909> the earth, <WG1093> and <WG2532> taken your pleasure. <WG5171> You have nourished <WG5142> your <WG5216> hearts <WG2588> as <WG5613> in <WG1722> a day <WG2250> of slaughter. <WG4967>
You have condemned, <WG2613> you have murdered <WG5407> the righteous <WG1342> one. <WG498> He doesn't <WG3756> resist <WG498> you. <WG5213>

Be patient <WG3114> therefore, <WG3767> brothers, <WG80> until <WG2193> the coming <WG3952> of the Lord. <WG2962> Behold, <WG2400> the farmer <WG1092> waits for <WG1551> the precious <WG5093> fruit <WG2590> of the earth, <WG1093> being patient <WG3114> over <WG846> it, <WG846> until <WG2193> <WG99999> it receives <WG2983> the early <WG4406> and <WG2532> late <WG3797> rain. <WG5205>
You <WG5210> also <WG2532> be <WG3114> patient. <WG3114> Establish <WG4741> your <WG5216> hearts, <WG2588> for <WG3754> the coming <WG3952> of the Lord <WG2962> is at hand. <WG1448>

Don't <WG3361> grumble, <WG4727> brothers, <WG80> against <WG2596> one another, <WG240> so that you won't <WG3361> be judged. <WG4253> Behold, <WG2400> the judge <WG4253> stands <WG2476> at <WG3588> the door. <WG2476>

Take, <WG2983> <WG3450> brothers, <WG80> for an example <WG5262> of suffering <WG2552> and <WG2532> of patience, <WG3115> the prophets <WG4396> who <WG3739> spoke <WG2980> in the name <WG3686> of the Lord. <WG2962>

Behold, <WG2400> we call <WG3106> them <WG3588> blessed <WG3106> who endured. <WG5278> You have heard <WG191> of the patience <WG5281> of Job, <WG2492> and <WG2532> have seen <WG1492> the Lord <WG2962> in the outcome, <WG5056> and <WG2532> how the Lord <WG2962> is <WG2076> full of compassion <WG4184> and <WG2532> mercy. <WG3629>

But <WG1161> above <WG4253> all things, <WG3956> my <WG3450> brothers, <WG80> don't <WG3361> swear, <WG3660> neither <WG3383> by heaven, <WG3772> nor <WG3383> by the earth, <WG1093> nor by any <WG5100> other <WG243> oath; <WG3727> but <WG1161> let <WG2277> your <WG5216> "yes <WG3483>" be <WG2277> "yes, <WG3483>" and <WG2532> your <WG5216> "no, <WG3756>" "no; <WG3756>" so <WG2443> that you don't <WG3361> fall <WG4098> into <WG1519> hypocrisy. <WG3956>
Is <WG2553> any <WG5100> among <WG1722> you <WG5213> suffering? <WG2553> Let him pray. <WG4336> Is <WG2114> any <WG5100> cheerful? <WG2114> Let him sing praises. <WG5567>

Is <WG770> any <WG5100> among <WG1722> you <WG5213> sick? <WG770> Let him call <WG4341> for the elders <WG4245> of the assembly, <WG1577> and <WG2532> let them pray <WG4336> over <WG1909> him, <WG846> anointing <WG218> him <WG846> with oil <WG1637> in <WG1722> the name <WG3686> of the Lord, <WG2962>

and <WG2532> the prayer <WG2171> of faith <WG4102> will heal <WG4982> him who is sick, <WG2577> and <WG2532> the Lord <WG2962> will raise <WG1453> him <WG846> up. <WG1453> If <WG2579> he has <WG5600> committed <WG4160> sins, <WG266> he <WG846> will be forgiven. <WG863>

Confess <WG1843> your offenses <WG3900> to one another, <WG240> and <WG2532> pray <WG2172> for <WG5228> one <WG240> another, <WG240> that <WG3704> you may be healed. <WG2390> The insistent <WG1754> prayer <WG1162> of a righteous person <WG1342> is powerfully <WG4183> effective. <WG2480>

Elijah <WG2243> was <WG2258> a man <WG444> with a nature <WG3663> like <WG2254> ours, <WG2532> and he prayed <WG4336> earnestly <WG4335> that it might <WG1026> not <WG3361> rain, <WG1026> and <WG2532> it didn't <WG3756> rain <WG1026> on <WG1909> the earth <WG1093> for three <WG5140> years <WG1763> and <WG2532> six <WG1803> months. <WG3376>
<WG2532> He prayed <WG4336> again, <WG3825> and <WG2532> the sky <WG3772> gave <WG1325> rain, <WG5205> and <WG2532> the earth <WG1093> brought forth <WG985> its <WG846> fruit. <WG2590>
Brothers, <WG80> if <WG1437> any <WG5100> among <WG1722> you <WG5213> wanders <WG4105> from <WG575> the truth, <WG225> and <WG2532> someone <WG5100> turns <WG1994> him back, <WG846>

let him know <WG1097> that <WG3754> he who turns <WG1994> a sinner <WG268> from <WG1537> the error <WG4106> of his <WG846> way <WG3598> will save <WG4982> a soul <WG5590> from <WG1537> death, <WG2288> and <WG2532> will cover <WG2572> a multitude <WG4128> of sins. <WG266>
